result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey T Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Corey T Moore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Corey T Moore was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow early termination of probation after 6 months if agent deems appropriate

miscConds.notes:
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No violent contact with victim

Bail previously posted applied, costs paid in full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Expunction is conditionally granted after 1-year from today's date and upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

timeConds.notes: Perform 60 hours of community service at agents discretion

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey T Moore

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:31 p.m.
Attorney Shawn Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Corey T Moore. 
Defendant Corey T Moore in court.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 was previously dismissed on DA's motion.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2.  
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense requests expunction.  State has no position.
Court will grant expunction.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
60-Days Jail
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR
Court will allow early termination of probation after 6 months, if agent deems appropriate.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent contact with: victim
Perform 60 hours of Community Service

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash Bail in the amount of $1,000.00 to be applied to the costs/surcharge and the balance is to be refunded to the poster*

Expunction is conditionally granted after 1-year from today's date and upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Counseling letter filed by Atty. Zachary Hoff
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered;  filed by Atty. Zachary Hoff
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:23 AM Defendant Corey T Moore in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.  Bail remains as fixed.  States requests a plea hearing has an offer with a misdemeanor outcome.  State moves to dismiss count #1.  Atty. Hoff agrees to dismiss count #1 and enters a not guilty plea.  Mr. Moore agrees to count #1 being dismissed.  Court orders count #1 dismissed.  State complied with Marsey's law.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 06/24/2022:    If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Defendant to have no contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Cash bond previously posted on 5/2/2022.

09:15 AM Defendant Corey T Moore in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that there was a request for adjournment filed by attorney Hoff, however due to Marsy's Law could not adjourn.
Attorney Hoff is still requesting an adjournment.
The State does not object.
The Corut will adjourn.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Atty Zach Hoff requests to adjourn prelim. Sent to CC Costello for review. Court's response: Denied. Time limits waived, but Marsy's Law issue. Matter rescheduled for status on Prelim. Parties to appear for new date
filed by Attorney Zachary Hoff

Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Cash bond previously posted on 5/2/2022.

01:20 PM Defendant Corey T Moore in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.
